sentence.text: Here we perform an unbiased siRNA screen and identify that the second deubiquitinase, regulation of autophagy, regulates response to cytokine stability in lung and ovarian cancer cells.
As a result, regulation of autophagy depletion using CRISPR/Cas9 nuclease system inhibits tumor growth in xenografted nude mice.

We further report that genetic or pharmacological inhibition of regulation of autophagy considerably reduces response to cytokine protein abundance and significantly increases tumor cell sensitivity to BH3 mimetic inhibitors targeting BCL-2 and BCL-XL.

Collectively, we nominate regulation of autophagy as a novel deubiquitinase which regulates response to cytokine turnover in diverse solid tumors and propose that USP13 may be a potential therapeutic target for the treatment of various malignancies
